While leverage can fuel growth, it also poses substantial risks, especially if borrowing costs increase. In an environment where interest rates are rising, the cost of servicing this debt will rise as well, potentially squeezing margins and limiting growth. This is a critical concern, as it could severely impact the company’s ability to weather economic downturns and maintain its market position.

As we consider the current economic landscape, it is essential to recognize the probability of economic downturns or tightening monetary policy that could adversely affect consumer spending—a scenario with high probability.
